oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Votes for Women a Success (p. 3 of 4). Southern States Woman Suffrage Conference. No Date. Lizzie Crozier French Papers.

"Signed: "MRS. SOLON H. JACOBS, Birmingham, Ala., President of the Alabama Equal Suffrage Asoociation. "MRS. ALICE ELLINGTON, Little Rock, Ark., President of the Little Rock Political Equality League. "MRS. CHESTER JENNNGS, Little Rock, Ark., President of the Little Rock Political Equality League. "MRS. HELEN RAND TINDALL, Washington, D. C. "MRS. MARY F. McLENDON, Atlanta, Ga., President of the Georgia Equal Suffrage Association. "MRS. DESHA BRECKENRIDGE, Lexington, Ky., Presi- , dent of the Kentucky Equal Rights Association. "MISS LAURA CLAY.. Lexington, Ky., Secretry of the Ken- tucky Equal Rights Association. "MRS. SARAH CLAY BENNETT, Richmond, Ky.f "MRS. MARY B. CLAY, Richmond, Ky. "MISS KATE M. GORDON, New Orleans, La., President of the Louisiana State Suffrage Association. "MISS FLORENCE LOEBER, New Orleans, La., Presi- dent of the Era Club of New Orleans. MRS. EMMA MADDOX FUNCK, Baltimore, Md., Presi- dent of the Maryland Woman Suffrage Association. "MRS. DONALD R. HOOKER, Baltimore, Md., President of the Just Government League. "MRS. ANNIE KINKEAD DENT, Yazoo City, Miss., President of the Mississippi Woman Suffrage Asso- ciation. "MRS. ROBERT SOMERVILLE, Greenville,' Miss. "MRS. EUGENE REILLY, Charleston, S. C. "MRS. ADELIA C. STEPHENS, Oklahoma City, Okla., President of the Oklahoma Woman Suffrage Asso- ciation. "MRS. MARY WINTHROP GIBBON, Charleston, S. C. "MISS SARAH BARNWELL ELLIOTT, Sewanee, President of the Tennessee Suffrage Association. "MISS M. ELEANOR BRACKENRIDGE, San Antonio, President of the Texas Equal Franchise Society. "MRS. B. B. VALENTINE, Richmond, Va., President of the Equal Suffrage League of Virginia. "MRS. HELEN GARDINER, Washington, D.
It was hardly to be expected that the Governors would attend this conference, but it was thrilling warning to backward legislatures that the hour has come when the women must come into their own.
